intro: Galium jordanii var. gracilicaule, commonly known as slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and opposite, lanceolate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers in clusters, typically blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Galium jordanii var. gracilicaule is a herbaceous perennial with a low-growing habit, typically reaching heights of less than 30 centimeters.
